name: Keiji Kimura
content: WASEDA UNIVERSITY Computer Science and Engineering Kimura Laboratory | Japanese | English | Private Page Professor Research Publications Members Class Infomeation Location Kasahara Lab Links KIMURA, Keiji Keiji Kimura received the Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering from Waseda University in 2001. He was an assistant professor in 2004, an associate professor in 2005, and a professor in 2012 at Waseda University. He has been a director of Green Computing System Research Organization at Waseda since 2019. He is a recipient of the 2014 MEXT (Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology in Japan) award. His research interests include multicore processor architecture, parallelizing compiler technologies, and secure computer systems. He is a member of IPSJ, ACM, and IEEE. He has served on the program committee of many conferences.
